value: (板橋區) is the city seat of New Taipei.
(八里區) is the newest tourist place in New Taipei.
(福隆) is a coastal district with good beach and surfing.
(九份) was a prosperous gold mining area. It now attracts travelers who want a trip back in time.

(淡水區) is a historical district on the north coast that was once the center of shipping and commerce in northern Taiwan. The district is still a popular day-trip destination from Taipei and boasts many historical attractions.
(烏來) is a small village famous for its hot springs and aboriginal culture.
(新店區) is a district south of Taipei where the apartment complexes of the metropolis meet the northern end of the Central Mountain Range.
(新莊區) is a suburban district located in the south of New Taipei.
(鶯歌區) is a district known for its high concentration of pottery and ceramic makers.
(永和區) is known for its breakfast foods.
(中和區) is another suburban district of New Taipei.

New Taipei is basically an extension of Taipei and is the home of more than 3,500,000 people. The city has quite a diverse environment, from the densely populated industrial districts of Sanchong and Shulin to the coastal regions around the district of

and the sparsely populated mountain districts near Shenkeng.

Before 25 Dec 2010, New Taipei was known as Taipei County.

) is the main international airport on the island, and the closest major airport to New Taipei. However, be aware that this name was only adopted in September 2006, the old name, Chiang Kai Shek International Airport (often abbreviated as CKS), is still commonly used. Airbus operates an
route that directly connects Taoyuan International Airport, Tucheng and
. The bus runs every 30 minutes during the day and costs NT$135. Travelers going to other regions of New Taipei however may have to visit
city first, and head to the destination from there.

value: (板橋車站) is the major transportation hub in New Taipei. This station connects the railways, Taipei MRT and Taiwan High Speed Rail. It also has local and inter-city bus stations. (Wunhua Road Sec. 1, Banqiao City)

Inter-city buses arrive and depart from the

's terminal. The inter-city bus terminal is just east of the Banqiao Railway Station, and the local bus terminal is in the west. Bus services are easily available, both to travel in the city and from or to nearby regions.
